result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James L. Schmidtke

records.addlTxt:
2:48 PM Defendant James L. Schmidtke appeared by phone.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared by video for James L. Schmidtke.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Klopp did provide an offer to the defendant in which he would like to accept; requests a plea/sentencing in person.

BY THE COURT:  Set plea/sentencing in person
bond continued
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:49 PM Defendant James L. Schmidtke in court.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp in court for James L. Schmidtke.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Klopp states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.   Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:39 PM Defendant James L. Schmidtke appeared by phone.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared by video for James L. Schmidtke.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Klopp states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Juech files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Klopp received a copy of the information but has not been able to share it with his client yet; requests Arraignment.

BY THE COURT:  Set arraignment
Arraignment scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Arraignment on September 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on August 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James L. Schmidtke in court.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared by video for James L. Schmidtke. 
Atty Klopp has an offer in which he did send that to the defendant but no response.  Atty Klopp states that his phone was disconnected that he had.  Defendant confirms his phone number.  
Atty Klopp asks for a prelim to be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set Preliminary Hearing
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on August 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Reinstate Signature bond

3:23 PM Defendant James L. Schmidtke appeared by video in custody. Attorney Anderson appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond.   Attorney Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the defendant on the reason for his non-appearance. Attorney Anderson explains his current living situation. 
Attorney Burdon requests a cash bond with prior condition of No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription  Attorney Anderson responds requesting the signature bond be reinstated.
BY THE COURT: Court will quash warrant and reinstate $500.00 Signature Bond with the prior condition of No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
Return date scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
of warrant cancellation

2:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James L. Schmidtke not in court.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared by video for James L. Schmidtke. 
Atty Klopp states that his client has been having issues with having a phone and he does not have a place to live.  Atty Burdon requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
of warrant cancellation MASO

3:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James L. Schmidtke appeared by video, in custody. 
Court questions the defendant as to why he failed to appear on June 13th.  Defendant was just evicted from his residence that he lived for 23 years so he didn't know when the court date was.  Court confirms address.  Defendant gives PO box number.

Atty Juech has no objection to reinstating the signature bond.

BY THE COURT:  Signature bond will be reinstated
Warrant quashed and satisfied
Status hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for James L. Schmidtke
Current: PO Box 354, Westfield, WI 53964   (Effective: 04-01-2022)
Prior: 133 E 5Th St, Westfield, WI 53964

2:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James L. Schmidtke not in court.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared by video for James L. Schmidtke. 
Atty Klopp is not aware of why his client is not here today.  Atty Juech requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:58 PM Defendant James L. Schmidtke appeared by phone.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared by video for James L. Schmidtke.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Klopp states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Klopp waives time limits for the Prelim.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Defendant agrees with the waiver of time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:29 AM Defendant James L. Schmidtke in court.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant was trying to get ahold of Atty Klopp but has not heard anything back yet; defendant states that he did call the Public Defender's office.
Court confirms address and phone. 

BY THE COURT:  Reset
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

03:26 PM Defendant James L. Schmidtke appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.

  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and wants to get an attorney.  

  Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription  Initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
